title: Jadon Sancho 'left out of Dortmund squad after the star returned late from England duty'
text:
Dortmund winger Jadon Sancho has been dropped from the team's game against Borussia Monchengladbach after coming back late from England duty.

His manager Lucien Favre has decided to discipline his star man for the Bundesliga clash despite Sancho chipping in with three goals and five assists in six appearances this season.

Dortmund are ninth in the German top tier this season after a mixed start, and welcome surprise league leaders Monchengladbach to Signal Iduna Park on Saturday.

Jadon Sancho has been vital for Lucien Favre's side and has scored three goals this season

According to Kicker, Favre is laying down the law to a player who has a history of tardiness at the German giants.

In the 2017/18 campaign Sancho was temporarily sent to the U23 squad by former manager Peter Stoger after turning up late for training on a number of occasions.

Speaking before the important clash with the league leaders on Thursday, Favre said Sancho 'still has a lot to learn'.

It is not the first time Sancho has been disciplined for lateness, the last coming in 2017/18

'The expectations of Jadon are enormous, but that is dangerous. Jadon is a great player, no discussions, but he still has a lot to learn.'

Sancho was largely ineffective as England were beaten by the Czech Republic 2-1 for their first qualifying defeat in ten years.

The winger is starting to become a key attacking figure for England under Gareth Southgate

He then came on for the Three Lions in their 6-0 demolition of Bulgaria. He scored twice in last month's 5-3 success against Kosovo as he has come into the thoughts of manager Gareth Southgate.

Recently Sancho has been linked with moves to the Premier League after a stellar season in Germany last year. He scored 12 goals and provided 14 assists as Dortmund finished as runners-up to Bayern Munich and reached the Champions League knockout stages.
